archetype_name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
name: Provençal Baked Fish with Tomato–Fennel and Herbed Couscous
description: Mild, low-sodium baked white fish nestled in a tomato–fennel braise with thyme and bay, served alongside fluffy lemon–parsley couscous. Comforting and family-friendly with classic French bistro notes.
prep_steps: Slice 1 fennel bulb thinly (save fronds for garnish if present).
Dice 1 onion and mince 3 cloves garlic.
Rinse and pat dry 4 fish fillets.
Zest 1 lemon, then cut the lemon into wedges.
Rinse and chop a small handful of parsley.
Measure 1 cup couscous and 1 cup water.
cook_steps: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and fennel; cook 5–6 minutes until softened, stirring occasionally.
Stir in garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add 1/2 cup white wine and simmer 2 minutes to reduce slightly.
Stir in 1 can (about 14 oz) crushed tomatoes, 1 teaspoon thyme, 1 bay leaf, and a few grinds of black pepper; simmer 3–4 minutes.
Nestle fish fillets into the sauce in a single layer; spoon some sauce over the tops.
Transfer skillet to the oven and bake 10–14 minutes until fish flakes easily.
While fish bakes, bring 1 cup water to a boil in a small pot; remove from heat, stir in 1 teaspoon olive oil, lemon zest, and couscous; cover and rest 5 minutes.
Fluff couscous with a fork; fold in chopped parsley and a squeeze of lemon.
Remove bay leaf; taste sauce and adjust pepper or lemon to keep flavors bright without added salt.
Serve fish and tomato–fennel sauce with herbed couscous; garnish with fennel fronds and lemon wedges.
